notesStmt.note: Damage and stains at ends, including tidemarks. Usage stains, and some foxing. Some losses of text.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A collection of legal and kabbalistic works.

msItem.title: Liḳutim shonim be-ḳabalah לקוטים שונים בקבלה

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 to 10 leaves each.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive and square script of the 16th century.

binding.p: Pre-1600. Brown leather. Spine: 'Jacob Ben Asher. Perush Hat-Torah. Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,034.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 140: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [399v] (fse001v).
